author: Jose Cedeno (KING 5)
title: West Seattle gaming cafe welcomes everyone, including dogs
text:
SEATTLE —
Till Dawn in West Seattle is a gaming cafe that is both dog and family friendly, but also caters to the nighttime crowd.
"It's kind of an all in one, you know, for the person who wants to come hangout with friends and they need some place to chill and have a beer," Annie Yu said.
The cafe has a mix between arcades, pinball and a console tower. It also features a private room for customers to play Dungeons and Dragons.
"Anyone from back in the day or somebody who just got hooked on it is going to enjoy it", said owner Andrew Spence.
The space is open to everyone.
"Kids of all ages are welcome any time," Spence said. "Whether they know how to play games already or whether they want to learn."
"If I were describing Till Dawn to a friend, I would say it's kind of like a nice home away from home. It feels like the arcade we all wanted when we were kids," said Lacey Gonzalez. "Immediately when you walk in, you feel like a regular."
"I would really come here for the really good coffee that we carry" Yu said.
"Also, just the amazing snacks that we have. Like a lot of Asian baked goods or Asian snacks in general."
The menu features specialty food items, which includes fruit sandwiches, cinnamon rolls, cream puffs, and hojicha croissants.
Till Dawn is located at 5048 California Ave. S.W., Seattle, WA 98136 and is open 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily except for Mondays.

author: Bridget Galton
title: Frost Fair revival at Bankside London on the river Thames | Ham & High
text: Lest you think that extreme weather events are unique to modern life, there was an extraordinary period in London’s history when the River Thames froze over 24 times between 1605 and 1814. Unable to work, sailors, bargeman and riverside dwellers created an ‘on ice’ fair with markets, traditional games, gambling, and entertainment on the frozen river. During the last Frost Fair in 1814, an elephant famously walked across the ice by Blackfriars Bridge. It's a scene recreated in an episode of Dr Who, which gets an outdoor screening as part of the revived [Frost Fair](https://banksidelondon.co.uk/frost-fair/) on Bankside this month. Back for a second year, the event includes music and entertainment, guided tours with a Frost Fair theme, and a parade with a life-size puppet elephant. Visitors can also take a free craft workshop, shop at an artisan market, take a horse and carriage ride beside the Thames, or play traditional games such as skittles. The Frost Fair Fringe will see Bankside businesses recreate food, drink, and activities associated with the historic fair, including hot apples, gingerbread, mulled wine and hot chocolate, plus drinks you may never have heard of like ‘Old Tom Gin’ and ‘Hot Purl’. (Gin and wormwood wine which is similar to vermouth) Organised by Business Improvement District (BID) [Better Bankside](https://betterbankside.co.uk/), the three day event is a welcome opportunity to chase away the winter blues with activities, spectacles, and themed feasting, bringing alive the area and its businesses. Nicole Gordon CEO of Better Bankside said; “We are incredibly excited to be hosting Bankside’s second Frost Fair. The activities and events will spark joy for everyone at an often gloomy time of year. "It is wonderfully nostalgic to recreate an event which is so unique in Bankside’s rich history. But aside from just looking back, the Frost Fair resonates with the spirit of ‘London’s Other Side’ today. When the river froze, the fair not only provided entertainment, it also supported the local community through offering much-needed employment for out of work bargemen. "The mentality of community, creativity and resilience is still very much alive and well today amongst Banksiders. The Frost Fair is one of the ways we can share Bankside, as an area and community, with others." Taking place on Sumner Street behind the Tate Modern the Frost Fair runs from Friday 26 January to Sunday 28 January. Events are free but the BID is encouraging donations to help ‘freeze out homelessness’ for the [Manna Society](https://www.mannasociety.org.uk/), a local day centre working with the homeless and vulnerable.

author: AFP
title: Maduro afirma que Venezuela avanza en un sistema antidrones - LA NACION
text:
El presidente venezolano, Nicolás Maduro, ordenó el jueves una "readecuación" del aparato de defensa de su país, con un sistema antidrones en zonas estratégicas, entre denuncias de planes para derrocarlo. Maduro se reunió con el alto mando de la Fuerza Armada, que le ha jurado lealtad tras su cuestionada reelección para un tercer mandato de seis años seguidos, denunciada como fraude por la oposición.
"Estamos avanzando aceleradamente en las capacidades de drones para la defensa nacional y hay que tener defensa antidron en todos los objetivos vitales: aeropuertos, puertos, etcétera, es muy importante", dijo Maduro en un acto por el 19 aniversario del Comando Estratégico Operacional (CEO), responsable del manejo de la tropa.
"Es necesario hacer una readecuación (...), una reingeniería de los procesos de inteligencia y contrainteligencia estratégica, militar y policial del Estado venezolano para adaptarlo a las nuevas circunstancias del siglo XXI y en especial a las circunstancias de Venezuela", añadió.
Maduro denuncia a menudo conspiraciones en su contra, que atribuye normalmente a la oposición con cooperación de Estados Unidos. Después de conocerse los resultados oficiales de la elección, estallaron protestas en todo el país que terminaron con saldo de 27 muertos, casi 200 heridos y más de 2.400 detenidos.
"Le reiteramos toda nuestra lealtad", señaló su ministro de Defensa, general Vladimir Padrino López, en el acto.
El mandatario insistió además en la revisión de "todos los equipos que se hayan comprado", a propósito de los ataques a Hezbolá, en Líbano, mediante explosiones de dispositivos de comunicación, que dejaron 37 muertos y casi 3.000 heridos.
"Máxima seguridad", pidió el gobernante, que ya antes ordenó a funcionarios de su gobierno y partidarios no aceptar equipos electrónicos como regalos de Navidad.
Mbj/jt/mr

author: @laprensalatina
title: 7 dead in south Thailand flooding - La Prensa Latina Media
text: [Weather](https://www.laprensalatina.com/category/weather/) 7 dead in south Thailand flooding Bangkok, Dec 29 (EFE).- Torrential rains have triggered severe flooding in southern Thailand, claiming seven lives and affecting thousands of people, authorities said Friday. The casualties were reported from the Narathiwat province that has borne the brunt, with water levels exceeding two meters in some areas. One person was missing as search operations are on. More than 260,000 people have been affected by the flooding, according to data from the government’s disaster management agency. Rescue efforts are underway. The water level exceeded two meters in some villages in Narathiwat, where residents took shelter on rooftops or upper floors of their houses, waiting for help from emergency services. Flood waters have already started receding little by little, while neighboring provinces of Yala and Pattani have also been affected, the public broadcaster Thai PBS reported. The floods forced the closure of some of roads that connect the region and the temporary suspension of the railway services, which has now resumed its normal activity. Some regions in neighboring Malaysia were also hit, and some 28,000 people have been evacuated from their homes, according to official data. Although the water level has begun to recede in some areas, the Thai Meteorological Department predicted that heavy rains would continue over the weekend. EFE nc-ssk

author: Natalia Toczkowska
title: Ukrainian Strike Hits Russian Landing Ship Novocherkassk in Crimea
text:
Ukrainian Strike Hits Russian Landing Ship Novocherkassk in Crimea
Satellite imagery has unveiled the significant damage sustained by the Russian tank landing ship Novocherkassk following an offensive by Ukrainian forces on a port situated in Crimea. The visuals, provided by Maxar Technologies, showcase the aftermath of the attack with the vessel appearing to be engulfed in smoke, disconnected from the dock, and partially submerged in water.
This incident marks a key moment in the Ukrainian counteroffensive, demonstrating their capability to strike high-value targets. Ukraine has declared success in destroying the Novocherkassk at the port of Feodosia—a claim countered by Moscow, asserting only damage occurred. Prior satellite images capture the ship before the strike, fully intact, highlighting the extent of the inflicted damages post-attack.
A Ukrainian Navy spokesperson expressed difficulties in obtaining precise casualty figures given the Russian occupation of Crimea. Nonetheless, the realistic possibility of crew casualties was noted, considering the full capacity of the ship usually hosts about 80 people.
The Novocherkassk, a Ropucha-class landing ship detailed in a US military fact sheet, is quite substantial, equivalent in size to a US Navy littoral combat ship. Its design supports beach landings and can carry a crew complement of approximately 87 personnel, with additional capacity for 237 troops.
Further adding to the strategic significance of this strike, the Ukrainian Air Force commander reported that the Novocherkassk had been transporting Iranian-made Shahed attack drones. This incident follows the previous sinking of the Moskva, another principal vessel of Russia’s Black Sea Fleet, reinforcing Ukraine’s resolve against Russian military resources.
While Russia’s Defense Ministry has acknowledged the events, firm verification of the attack’s details remains challenging. Despite this, reports from Russian authorities confirm at least one casualty and several injuries due to the offensive. The attack denotes another considerable setback for Russian military operations, coinciding with Ukraine’s persistent defense in the east and the potential threat to the strategic city of Avdiivka. The ongoing conflict continues to exhibit high-stakes encounters with repercussions on both sides.
FAQs about the Attack on the Russian Landing Ship Novocherkassk
What happened to the Russian tank landing ship, Novocherkassk?
Satellite imagery showed significant damage to the Russian tank landing ship Novocherkassk following an attack by Ukrainian forces on a port in Crimea. The imagery depicted the ship with smoke, disconnected from the dock, and partially submerged.
Who provided the satellite images, and what do they show?
Maxar Technologies provided the satellite images showing the damaged vessel after the attack.
What does this incident signify for the Ukrainian counteroffensive?
This incident illustrates Ukraine’s ability to strike high-value targets effectively and is considered a key moment in their counteroffensive efforts.
Has there been any confirmation of casualties?
Precise casualty figures are hard to obtain due to Russian occupation, but considering the ship’s typical crew complement, there is a realistic possibility of crew casualties.
What is the Novocherkassk, and what can it do?
The Novocherkassk is a Ropucha-class landing ship of substantial size, similar to a US Navy littoral combat ship and designed for beach landings. It can carry about 87 crew members and an additional 237 troops.
Was the Novocherkassk carrying any significant cargo?
According to the Ukrainian Air Force commander, it was reported to be transporting Iranian-made Shahed attack drones at the time of the attack.
What has been Russia’s response to the attack?
The Russian Defense Ministry acknowledged the event, confirmed at least one casualty and several injuries, but details and the full extent of the damage remain challenging to verify.
What is the impact of this attack on the wider conflict?
The attack contributes to setbacks for Russian military operations and highlights the ongoing high-stakes nature of the conflict, with both sides facing significant repercussions.
Definitions of Key Terms:
– Ropucha-class landing ship: A class of landing ship used by the Russian Navy, designed for beach landings and capable of carrying large numbers of troops and vehicles.
– Littoral combat ship: A class of relatively small surface vessels used by the US Navy for operations near the shore (littorals).
– Shahed attack drones: Unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) produced in Iran and used for various military applications, including reconnaissance and combat.
Related Links:
–
Maxar Technologies – Provider of the satellite imagery showing the aftermath of the attack.
–
Russian Defense Ministry – Official site of the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation.
–
US Navy – Regarding information on the US Navy’s littoral combat ships for comparison purposes.
Please note that websites listed are based on their relevance to the article’s content, their main domains, and provided that the URLs are deemed valid at the time of this writing.
Natalia Toczkowska is a notable figure in digital health technology, recognized for her contributions in advancing telemedicine and healthcare apps. Her work focuses on developing innovative solutions to improve patient care and accessibility through technology. Toczkowska’s research and development in creating user-friendly, secure digital platforms have been instrumental in enhancing the effectiveness of remote medical consultations and patient monitoring. Her dedication to integrating technology in healthcare has not only improved patient outcomes but also streamlined healthcare processes, making her a key influencer in the field of digital health innovation.

author: Cappadocia-Transfer
title: Cappadocia transfer No Further Mystery
text:
The beauty of Cappadocia is that while it is a fairytale location in summer, it only gets more and more beautiful in the winter. When it snows in Cappadocia it is truly a mesmerizing sight and something out of a dream world.
There were multiple times where we had to walk through a thin layer of mud, which I assume would be quite messy in the winter. All of this made it one of the most fun things to do in Cappadocia.
Goreme is generally the best area of Cappadocia to stay in because it başmaklık a huge variety of restaurants, tour shops, and cave hotels for all budgets — from backpacker to luxury hotels.
This activity is a good option for sightseeing birli this will give the opportunity to wander the dunes, valleys, trails, and hills of Cappadocia. The tour finishes right at sunset out in the valley of rock formations for an amazing sunset view.
A few different bus companies offer direct transport from Istanbul's main Esenler Otogar (bus station) and Istanbul's other bus station, Alibeykoy Otogar to Nevşehir Otogar on the outskirts of Nevsite city, approximately 18 kilometers west from the Cappadocia villages (depending on which village you're staying in).
There are 36 underground cities in Cappadocia and the deepest one is Derinkuyu. This city is 85 meters deep in the ground, and it özgü stables, churches, storage rooms, and thousands of ventilation ducts that gave it fresh air when people were living in it. It’s a fascinating place to explore!
Make sure you bring a flashlight and a jacket; it is considerably colder in the underground tunnels.
If you could reach us by sending an e-benzeyen or by WhatsApp, we would be appreciated to give all kind of services and information to you. Cappadocia Airport Transfer Reservation Form;
Ortahisar is another scenic town built on the hillside. It takes just a few minutes to view it from the road or you emanet take more time to explore it.
When it comes to hiking in Cappadocia, it is hard to go past Red Valley. The Sharp sandstone ridges glow a deep, vibrant red birli the sun burns into the unique landscape in the last moments of the sunset each night. If you only have a couple of nights in Cappadocia, this one is up high on the list for sunset spots.
November to February: If you do visit in February the weather is a bit more up and down but you have the chance to fly over snow, which would be a once in a lifetime experience. Some of the hiking trails will be great in the snow also!
Historically, Cappadocia Turkey is probably best known for being a place where Christians settled and sought refuge from the hostile çingene Empire, secretly carving thousands of houses, churches, and caves into the hills.
I hope my travels give you the motivation to set off on an epic adventure of your own. It’s been a wild ride.
here This is my Journey Era.
Kayseri Airport (70km/60 minutes) is the main airport and takes just over an hour by van/bus to reach Goreme Town
